args:
After receiving word that something is wrong
with Emile, Pia and Zodiark step in to help.
Under Edward's guidance, they disguise
themselves as servants and set off to infiltrate
the emperor's vacation manor.
Someone help! Please!\nEmperor Emile has lost his wits!
It's true! The other day, he suddenly\ntook flight and shut himself up in his\nvacation manor!
Maybe he just wanted some time off.\nHe's been working pretty hard lately,\nand it's not easy to run a whole country.
Guy's probably buildin' another big-arse\nstatue of himself in secret. I mean, he's\nall about sculptin' and junk, yeah?
Actually, our emperor has apparently\nhalted all of his artistic endeavors.
What's more, when we went to check on\nhim, we were all turned away.
Yeaaah, I still ain't seein' anything weird.\nThe guy's always been moody—probably\njust ate some bad clams or something.
It's possible this is all innocent, but my\ngut tells me something is amiss.

Although the hands that repelled us were
full of strength, his face was gaunt, and I
had the strangest feeling that he was...
Well, possessed by some kind of ghost.
A ghost?! ...Er, look. I understand your\nconcerns—I really do—but I think you\nmay be worrying too much here.

The boss is right. Take a couple'a deep
breaths, drink some tea, and just maybe
keep an eye on him for a bit. I mean,
Emile's Emile, but he's still a grown man.
...Perhaps I am jumping to conclusions.\nEmperor Emile does often say that we\nworry overmuch.
In fact, he said exactly that the other day\nwhen we went to check on him.

It is laudable for you to spare such
thoughts for your leader, but you need not
concern yourself with me. See that you get
some rest yourselves.

It was none other than Emperor Emile
himself who spoke those words of
consideration for us soldiers.
I'm sure he must be all right.
That's what I've been sayin'! See, 'cause...
Hold on. Emile'd never say somethin'\nlike that in a million years!
Something's wrong, I tells ya! WRONG!\nHe's GOTTA be possessed by somethin'!
WHY DIDN'T YA TELL US SOONER?!
I can't believe THAT is the thing which\nfinally made you believe me...
Of course it was! You should be shocked\nyerself to hear him talkin' like that!
Yeah, I'm starting to think there might\nactually be some sort of strange power\nat work here.
We gotta send help, toot sweet!
But who do we send? If he sees me,\nhe'll know something's up.
Yeah, probably best if it's somebody\nhe don't know...
Emile has come to see the Harmonia\nChoir perform before, but I still think the\nchance of his recognizing me is small.
But he said REALLY nice things about us,\nand I can't just stand by if someone like\nthat is in trouble!
Your concern is appreciated, Pia, but I\ncan't send a child off on this kind of\ninvestigation all alone.
Zodiark the Shadowwyrm\nOne of the Six Greatwyrms
Yeah, whenever I wanna keep a low\nprofile, I send in A FREAKIN' DRAGON!
Hmm. Good point. Then how about this?
Sweet crispy bacon!\nYa transformed into a human!
Such is the power of the Five Greatwyrms.\nI think I should be able to infiltrate his\nmanor in this form, no?

Yeah, that should work—and we'd all feel
a lot better if you were also on the case.
But why would you go to all this trouble
for my brother?
You father Aurelius—with whom my soul\nis fused—worries for his children. I would\nlike to put those fears to rest.
I see. In that case, we'd be thrilled\nto have your help.
Now we just need to figure out how to\nget you into Emile's manor...

Walkin' up and knockin' on the front door
ain't gonna do squat if the guy's sendin'
his own soldiers away, so we're gonna
have to be all sneaky-like about it.
I fear even that approach will be tricky;\nsecurity at the manor is formidable,\nand the head butler has a critical eye.

We once attempted to sneak a volunteer
in and they were found out within minutes.
No, I fear our only option is to storm the
location with overwhelming numbers.
We should probably hold off on that kind\nof thing until we understand better what's\nactually going on.
I'd prefer to approach Emile in a way that\nwon't create a lot of fuss and noise.\nAnyone have any good ideas?
It is I, sir—your butler par excellence,\nEdward.
Well, I see you haven't changed a bit.\nAnyway, tell me about your plan.
No matter how much he may wish to cast\naway all from his side, there are some\nEmile cannot do without.
By which I mean, a man of his makeup\ncannot do without the servants who wait\non him hand and foot.
As such, I think your team of infiltrators\nshould take on the guise of household\nstaff and gain employment in the manor.
Now THAT'S a good idea! Er, but how are\nthey supposed to do that, exactly?
Thankfully, I have many connections\nwith the local trade unions.
I shall inquire with them as to possible\nemployment, then instruct the pair in\nall things servant-related.

And as there is, of course, a limit to what
short-term instruction might accomplish,
I shall also accompany them under the
guise of their mentor.
That would be wonderful, Edward!\nBut are you sure you don't mind\ndoing all this?
Quite. You have proven yourself quite\nworthy these days, sir, making my constant\nguidance not so readily required.
But as I still live to serve, my next\n＂perfect duty＂ is to resolve any and all\nof your concerns.
In that case, I wish the three of you\nthe best of luck.
I shall delve closely into human ways\nthat I might be of assistance.
A great attitude for the both of you.\nNow without further ado, let us begin\nyour training.
Naturally. The basics of servitude cannot\nbe learned in a single day, after all.
By the time the infiltration date is decided,\nyou will be able to do all the basic tasks\nexpected of household staff.
I'll do my very, very best!
A few days later\nDyrenell Empire\nEmile's Manor
The moment has arrived at last.
We got through our training and got our\nletters of appointment, which means it's\ntime to infiltrate this place!
Thanks to Edward's training, we should fit\nright in as members of the staff.

The pair of you inspire great confidence.
Though it has been but a scarce few days,
it seems it was well worth the effort in
instructing you.

I would have you demonstrate the fruits of
our efforts to the fullest. Now let us enter
and uncover the truth behind what has
befallen good Master Emile.
Hee hee hee... It happened again...\nNew people again...
New FRIENDS have come! Eee hee!
